sentences.en: 'To be registered, as doomed to destruction,'returned Defarge.
sentences.cn: “ 记录在案.判决彻底消灭, ”德伐日回答.

sentences.en: All his intrigues are doomed to failure.
sentences.cn: 他所有的阴谋诡计注定要失败.

sentences.en: Any attempt to set back the wheel of history is doomed to failure.
sentences.cn: 任何要使历史倒退的企图都是注定要失败的.

sentences.en: Brad Pitt steals the show as the young man doomed by his zest for life.
sentences.cn: 布拉德·皮特扮演一名因对生命怀有极大热情而注定在劫难逃的年轻人，抢尽了镜头。

sentences.en: Fireman battled through the smoke in a doomed attempt to rescue the children.
sentences.cn: 消防队员奋力穿过烟雾企图去救孩子们，而这注定是要失败的。

sentences.en: He knew that if he lived, he would be doomed to spend the war as a prisoner.
sentences.cn: 他知道如果他活下来，他将注定以战俘的身份度过战争。

sentences.en: Many thought that he was doomed to ignominious failure.
sentences.cn: 许多人认为他注定会极不光彩地失败。

sentences.en: One who committed many injustices is doomed to failure.
Some poems are doomed to oblivion.
sentences.cn: 有些诗注定会被湮灭遗忘.

sentences.en: That argument doomed their marriage to failure.
sentences.cn: 那次争吵使他们的婚姻注定要失败。

sentences.en: The criminal was doomed to death.
The monolith, he suggested, was doomed by the tides of history.
sentences.cn: 他指出, 铁板一块的观念是注定要被历史的潮流所淹没的.

sentences.en: The prisoner was doomed to death.
Their plans seemed doomed to failure.
sentences.cn: 看起来，他们的计划注定要失败。

sentences.en: This fully shows that unregulated market economy is doomed to not work.
sentences.cn: 这充分说明，不受管理的市场经济是注定行不通的。

sentences.en: Those who go in for intrigues and conspiracy are doomed to failure.
sentences.cn: 搞阴谋诡计的人注定要失败.

trans.tran_cn: 命中注定的，难逃一死的
trans.tran_en: If something is doomed to happen, or if you are doomed to a particular state, something unpleasant is certain to happen, and you can do nothing to prevent it

trans.tran_cn: 注定（doom的过去式和过去分词），判定，使…的失败（或灭亡、毁灭、坏结局）成为必然，宣判
